required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Neurodynamic Mobilization Techniques in Patients With Diabetic Neuropathy
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Neurodynamic Mobilization Techniques in Patients With Diabetic Neuropathy

brief_summary.textblock: Neurodynamic mobilization Techniques and Selected Physical program used as a treatment for diabetic neuropathy patients and assessed by nerve condition study and function outcome.

detailed_description.textblock: Neurodynamic mobilization Techniques and Selected Physical program used as a treatment for diabetic neuropathy patients and assessed by nerve condition study and function outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of Neurodynamic Mobilization Techniques in Patients With Diabetic Neuropathy
primary_outcome.description: This study aimed to investigate neurodynamic mobilization effect on sensory and motor nerve conduction study, pain, and functional activity in patients with type 2 diabetic neuropathy and will be assessed through Katz index and NIHON KODEN EMG device.

arm_group.description: The NMG received three sessions/week for 4 weeks with each session lasting for 30 min including slider and tension neurodynamic techniques.
The participants only received a selected therapy program similar to the NMG with no change in duration.

intervention.description: The slider neurodynamic technique for the median nerve is conducted.Tensioner neurodynamic technique for the tibial nerve is conducted.
The participants only received a selected therapy program similar to the NMG with no change in duration.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with T2DM for â‰¥10 years determined by electrophysiological measurements were enrolled.
- The participants regularly took their diabetes medications during the assessment and treatment period.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Uncontrolled T2DM and diagnosed with T2DM for < 10 years.
- Patients with neural, muscular, and skeletal system deformities; radiculopathy; and psychiatric disorders.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Lecturer of Physical Therapy at department of Neurology

clinical_study.keyword: Neurodynamic technique; Sensory nerve conduction study; Motor nerve conduction study; Functional outcome; Diabetic polyneuropathy.
